Keywords: Armor , Latveria , Mystical , Ruler , Scientist
Real Name: Victor Von Doom
Special Powers
THE MANY FACES OF DOOM: At the beginning of the game, you may choose a starting line of equal points on a character from your sideline that also has this trait. If you do, replace this character with the chosen character.
TIME PLATFORM: Dr. Doom may start the game with FFFF #s010 Time Platform equipped. When he uses its EFFECT to choose to return to his starting area, he isn't dealt the 1 unavoidable damage.
I WANT THAT TREASURE!: FREE: Once per game, remove a FFFF #s010 Time Platform equipped to Dr. Doom from the game. If you do, equip Dr. Doom with an equipment of 10 points or less on an opponent's force (on the map or equipped to one of their characters).
LEARN FROM THE PAST: At the beginning of the game, roll two d6s and place the results on this card. If Dr. Doom is 150 points, roll three d6s instead. // Whenever any attack roll is made, you may replace a d6 in the roll with a d6 from this card.

May 12, 2021
Coyote's Own
Rule question in the rule section, because it's easier to post quotes and format post, and the discussion is more visible, etc. 12.2b Attack Roll The attacker then rolls 2d6. Only one attack roll is made, regardless of the number of targets of the attack Effects that allow dice to be rerolled or replaced are used during this step.Reroll effect must be used first, followed by effects that replace die, and then finally apply any effects that otherwise alter the attack roll (such as effects that increase or decrease the result). 12.2c Finalized Attack Roll Once all effects that alter the attack roll are applied, the attack roll is “finalized.” A finalized attack roll can no longer be altered by any effect. Since reroll effect (including PC) comes first according to the rulebook, the roll is finalized before anyone can replace a die. Edit: and as assumed any formating on the post is gone in the comments section making a squished together wall of text.

Unlike other characters who replace dice his doesn't say anything about removing the dice from his card when replacing. *EDIT* Since my comment WK has errata'd it so you do remove his dice once used.
